project.description: This job demonstrates how to create a Photon Server using the vCloud Air CLI. The job creates a server named 'photonTestVM' If the server exists, the creation is skipped. This job is called by the 'docker_photon' job to create a server. Run the 'Reset_Demo' job to delete the existing server, if necessary.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# Remove "" from input variables if present VAPP_NAME=`sed -e 's/^"//' -e 's/"$//' <<< $VAPP_NAME` VM_NAME=`sed -e 's/^"//' -e 's/"$//' <<< $VM_NAME`
# Login to vCloud Air
vca login --password $VCA_PASSWORD --save-password --host vchs.vmware.com --type subscription --version 5.6 --org M933009684-4424 vcadevops@gmail.com
vca vdc use --vdc M933009684-4424
export IP=`vca vm -a $VAPP_NAME | grep $VM_NAME | cut -d '|' -f5 | tr -d '[[:space:]]'` && echo $IP
# Create new Server, skip if Server already exists if [ ${#IP} -lt 1 ] then vca vapp create -a $VAPP_NAME -V $VM_NAME -c 'cf-catalog' -t 'Photon' -n M933009684-4424-default-routed -m DHCP vca vapp power.on --vapp $VAPP_NAME
# get the new vm ip IP=`/home/ubuntu/vcadevops/scenarios/jenkins/wait_boot_ip.sh $VAPP_NAME $VM_NAME`
# Add host entry sudo /home/ubuntu/vcadevops/scenarios/jenkins/add_host_entry.sh ${IP} ${VM_NAME}
# ssh to Proton Server and enable and start Docker sshpass -e ssh -t -v root@${IP} "systemctl enable docker && systemctl start docker && systemctl status docker" fi
